intro: Scleranthus polycarpos var. zapalowiczii, commonly known as the Zapalowicz's thornweed, is a variant of the common thornweed, characterized by its distinctive morphological features. It is a flowering plant belonging to the family Caryophyllaceae, known for its small, pinkish or white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or disturbed soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered with fine hairs, while the stems are rigid and spiny. This variant is of particular interest to botanists due to its unique ecological adaptations and limited distribution.
